bug.author: isaacmg
bug.summary: Wandb sweep hanging on Google Colab
bug.description:
wandb --version && python --version && uname
Weights and Biases version: 0.10.1 Python version: Python 3.6.9 Operating System: Google Colab
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
Trying to run a sweep on Google Colab. <denchmark-h:h3>What I Did</denchmark-h>
So there is no error the sweep just hangs indefinitely after the first run. <denchmark-code>wandb: Agent Finished Run </denchmark-code>
I then have to kill it manually <denchmark-code>wandb: Ctrl-c pressed. Waiting for runs to end. Press ctrl-c again to terminate them. Process Process-1: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/lib/python3.6/multiprocessing/process.py", line 258, in _bootstrap self.run() File "/usr/lib/python3.6/multiprocessing/process.py", line 93, in run self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/wandb/wandb_agent.py", line 69, in _start run._stop_jupyter_agent() AttributeError: 'Run' object has no attribute '_stop_jupyter_agent'
During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:
Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/lib/python3.6/multiprocessing/process.py", line 261, in _bootstrap util._exit_function() File "/usr/lib/python3.6/multiprocessing/util.py", line 319, in _exit_function p.join() File "/usr/lib/python3.6/multiprocessing/process.py", line 124, in join res = self._popen.wait(timeout) File "/usr/lib/python3.6/multiprocessing/popen_fork.py", line 50, in wait return self.poll(os.WNOHANG if timeout == 0.0 else 0) File "/usr/lib/python3.6/multiprocessing/popen_fork.py", line 28, in poll pid, sts = os.waitpid(self.pid, flag) KeyboardInterrupt </denchmark-code>
This is true even on relatively simple things: <denchmark-link:https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1u2xHJI_z-XoLTeFYGRzYS5PjdZGRakyG#scrollTo=HMRG0EnyyJYD>https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1u2xHJI_z-XoLTeFYGRzYS5PjdZGRakyG#scrollTo=HMRG0EnyyJYD</denchmark-link>
I also tested just using a generic train function with no model and it still fails. <denchmark-link:https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1Ek-BpLf6BTXaZORGhgAi3NZo07mMw9nO#scrollTo=SAqGr4Vjp6ml>https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1Ek-BpLf6BTXaZORGhgAi3NZo07mMw9nO#scrollTo=SAqGr4Vjp6ml</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.95. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/isaacmg>@isaacmg</denchmark-link> we're aware of the issue. With 0.10.1 you can use an experimental agent by replacing with which should fix the stalling issue.
Thanks. BTW for those wondering what the import statement looks like it is from wandb.jupyteragent import jupyteragent as _secretagent
